alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 3:13PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cedar, northwestern Scott and southwestern Clinton Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 312 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tipton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bennett around 320 PM CDT. Lowden around 330 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Wheatland, Toronto, Grand Mound, Calamus and Donahue. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 255 and 283. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
